intro: Miliusa tenuistipitata, commonly known as the slender-stipitate miliusa, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves with smooth margins. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by oval, woody fruits containing one or two seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
